E260F376362C453D8427A6A5D030C5BD.description: Analyze and discuss, how dances from a variety of cultures, societies, historical periods, or communities reveal the ideas and perspectives of the people.

708C8BBB7BC1459CACF3ECBA4B38D188.description: CONNECT: Relate artistic ideas and works with societal, cultural, and historical context to deepen understanding

F4A29BA5F4FB4DFBAA27ED3C51B358E3.description: Investigate two contrasting topics using a variety of research methods. Identify and organize ideas to create representative movement phrases. Create a dance study exploring the contrasting ideas. Discuss how the research informed the choreographic process and deepens understanding of the topics.

848FD537E9834A669F7341FC7E9F2D5D.description: Relate connections found between different dances and discuss the relevance of the connections to the development of oneâ€™s personal perspectives.

9D7AE6C8031A4A52AD1031AE78939F84.description: CONNECT: Synthesize and relate knowledge and personal experiences to make art.

C7530DB478EB4C4BA3D783A6CE64E667.description: Use artistic criteria to determine what makes an effective performance. Consider content, context, genre, style, or cultural movement practice to comprehend artistic expression. Use genre-specific dance terminology.

7910A8871A1846F7B6C86653138DAF6E.description: PERFORM: Apply criteria to evaluate artistic work.

5C56B5D36F67493AA9B54D656DD59C79.description: Select a dance and explain how artistic expression is achieved through relationships among the elements of dance, use of body, dance technique and context. Cite evidence in the dance to support your interpretation using genre specific dance terminology.

C45F5ABBB5F541BF9431F33F5569CA80.description: RESPOND: Interpret intent and meaning in artistic work.

F70130BD788846E8BCF7E6A49093D097.description: Explain how the elements of dance are used in a variety of genres, styles, or cultural movement practices to communicate intent. Use genre specific dance terminology.

1BDBEF8C4E974E40B44225944BC3CC2E.description: Describe, demonstrate and discuss patterns of movement and their relationships in dance in context of artistic intent.

6A08E14B112E421393B6DA818A0ED5BF.description: RESPOND: Perceive and analyze artistic work.

E01677D701704FDBABE9B24BA8B9646E.description: Collaborate to design and execute production elements that would intensify and heighten the artistic intent of a dance performed on a stage, in a different venue, or for different audiences. Explain reasons for choices using production terminology.

449B2BB6927E4B478AE8DAC1648896FF.description: Demonstrate leadership qualities (for example commitment, dependability, responsibility, and cooperation) when preparing for performances. Use performance etiquette and performance practices during class, rehearsal and performance. Document efforts and create a plan for ongoing improvements. Post performance, accept notes from choreographer and apply corrections to future performances.

700E8D27083B42A3868A8CF4533C68CD.description: PERFORM: Convey meaning through the presentation of artistic work.

FCB16E85459343AF8C5590F00E271145.description: Collaborate with peers to discover strategies for achieving performance accuracy, clarity, and expressiveness. Articulate personal performance goals and practice to reach goals. Document personal improvement over time (for example, journaling, portfolio, or timeline).

937D52298E6A4CC6B98E024A60490A11.description: Evaluate personal healthful practices in dance activities and everyday life including nutrition and injury prevention. Discuss choices made, the effects experienced, and methods for improvement.

46F628588F9041D88ADEBAA4492A4D13.description: Embody technical dance skills (for example, functional alignment, coordination, balance, core support, clarity of movement, weight shifts, flexibility/range of motion) to replicate, recall, and execute spatial designs and musical or rhythmic

0ED1AE67DB29445BBC85236EF37A4CF7.description: PERFORM: Develop and refine artistic techniques and work for presentation.

C151CCEEF3F84F30B37A44F004D7B8C8.description: Direct energy and dynamics in such a way that movement is textured. Incorporate energy and dynamics to technique exercises and dance performance. Use energy and dynamics to enhance and project movements.

B5415340487D4957B5B18CCC91555F76.description: Analyze and select metric, kinetic, and breath phrasing and apply appropriately to dance phrases. Perform dance phrases of different lengths that use various timings within the same section. Use different tempi in different body parts at the same time

BCEF7890FD41426583399F46BBA270DD.description: Sculpt the body in space and design body shapes in relation to other dancers, objects, and environment. Use focus of eyes during complex floor and air patterns or direct and indirect pathway

288315B30EAA448F9C55A86D6743EA15.description: PERFORM: Select, Analyze, and interpret artistic work for presentation.

9B637AC0A3994D59BE0BFACFE49119D1.description: Experiment with aspects of a recognized system to document a section of a dance by using words, symbols, or media technologies.

771E32EB4D90433F901BCADE337D4F86.description: Revise choreography collaboratively or independently based on artistic criteria, self-reflection, and the feedback of others. Articulate the reasons for choices and revisions and explain how they clarify and enhance the artistic intent.

5DA3857B1C98453FB0F9416A245AE8F2.description: CREATE: Refine and complete artistic work.

AEC3226607E84087876E4E6CF768CCA1.description: Define and apply artistic criteria to choreograph a dance that communicates personal or cultural meaning. Discuss how the criteria clarify or intensify the meaning of the dance.

D6B7CCB1905F4BC881AFC6494F080620.description: Collaborate to select and apply a variety of choreographic devices and dance structures to choreograph an original dance study or dance with a clear artistic intent. Articulate the group process for making movement and structural choices.

D6691DABD0D745FC82F7471F94535DB4.description: CREATE: Organize and develop artistic ideas and work.

126BF3CA8A284780847F702819989289.description: Â Identify and select personal preferences to create an original dance study or dance. Use genre specific dance terminology to articulate and justify choices made in movement development to communicate intent

5D266457DEBE46B9955058A371072055.description: Implement movement from a variety of stimuli (for example, music, observed dance, literary forms, notation, natural phenomena, personal experience/recall, current news or social events) to develop dance content for an original dance study or dance

9E81A3DCA80D4FDC92D0B83906215147.description: CREATE: Generate and conceptualize artistic ideas and work.
